docs.abstract: Getting companies to pay for the information they reap from people’s online lives will improve the data and may counteract a concentration of power.
docs.snippet: Getting companies to pay for the information they reap from people’s online lives will improve the data and may counteract a concentration of power.
docs.lead_paragraph: Should Facebook pay us for our puppy pictures?

headline.main: Your Data Is Crucial to a Robotic Age. Shouldn’t You Be Paid for It?
headline.print_headline: Getting Tech Giants to Pay You for Your Data

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Radical Markets: Uprooting Capitalism and Democracy for a Just Society (Book)

docs.abstract: Saudi officials to visit Wall Street this week, a report on Americans’ incomes and the New York auto show.
docs.snippet: Saudi officials to visit Wall Street this week, a report on Americans’ incomes and the New York auto show.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what to expect in the week ahead:

headline.main: Apple Unveils Education Product and S.U.V.s Take the Stage at New York Auto Show
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Education Push; S.U.V.s Will Rule Show

docs.abstract: The spokeswoman, Dana Loesch, spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference a day after addressing those affected by the school shooting in Parkland, Fla.
docs.snippet: The spokeswoman, Dana Loesch, spoke at the Conservative Political Action Conference a day after addressing those affected by the school shooting in Parkland, Fla.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dana Loesch, the spokeswoman for the National Rifle Association, focused her ire on the news media in a combative and defiant speech on Thursday, in sharp contrast to the approach she took before an audience of gun violence survivors a day earlier.

headline.main: With Florida Shooting Survivors, N.R.A. Spokeswoman Holds Back. With Conservatives, It’s a Different Story.

docs.abstract: The airline said it did nothing wrong but agreed to pay $15 million and provide information to the plaintiffs. Three other airlines are still fighting.
docs.snippet: The airline said it did nothing wrong but agreed to pay $15 million and provide information to the plaintiffs. Three other airlines are still fighting.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has approved a $15 million settlement between Southwest Airlines and members of a class-action lawsuit who allege that the company, along with three other airlines, conspired to limit the number of seats available to customers and keep ticket prices high.

headline.main: Southwest Airlines Settles Suit but Denies Colluding to Keep Ticket Prices High

docs.abstract: The former television star and the network he appeared on rebutted claims by three women that he defamed them by portraying them as liars and extortionists.
docs.snippet: The former television star and the network he appeared on rebutted claims by three women that he defamed them by portraying them as liars and extortionists.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Bill O’Reilly and Fox News on Tuesday argued for the dismissal of the defamation lawsuit brought against them by three women who reached harassment settlements involving Mr. O’Reilly, asserting that they had not disparaged the women because any comments they made were not directed at the women and did not refer to them.

headline.main: O’Reilly and Fox News Seek to Dismiss Defamation Suit
headline.print_headline: O’Reilly and Fox News Seek to Dismiss Defamation Suit

docs.abstract: A look at industrial centers of the North and the East over decades of decline finds that investments, geography and sheer serendipity make a difference.
docs.snippet: A look at industrial centers of the North and the East over decades of decline finds that investments, geography and sheer serendipity make a difference.
docs.lead_paragraph: St. Cloud, Minn., might look at first blush like one of America’s all-too-familiar ailing industrial cities, struggling to hang on to jobs as its companies skip town.

headline.main: Lessons From Rust-Belt Cities That Kept Their Sheen
headline.print_headline: For Industrial Cities In Decline, Lessons On Staying Rust-Free

docs.abstract: Paul Jacobs, whose father helped found Qualcomm, will not be renominated to the board after he began considering taking the chip maker private.
docs.snippet: Paul Jacobs, whose father helped found Qualcomm, will not be renominated to the board after he began considering taking the chip maker private.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Qualcomm was co-founded in 1985 by Irwin Jacobs, who took the company public and made it a mobile chips behemoth. He later passed the baton to his son Paul.

headline.main: Qualcomm’s Ex-Chairman to Leave Amid Plans to Buy Company
headline.print_headline: Qualcomm’s Former Chairman Will Leave Amid Plans to Take the Chip Company Private

docs.abstract: Centrica reported a 17.4 percent fall in full-year operating profits, to 1.25 billion pounds.
docs.snippet: Centrica reported a 17.4 percent fall in full-year operating profits, to 1.25 billion pounds.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Centrica, owner of British Gas and the largest energy supplier in the country, said it would cut about 4,000 jobs by 2020 as profits fell and it continued to lose customers.

headline.main: Centrica, Britain’s Largest Energy Supplier, to Cut 4,000 Jobs
headline.print_headline: Top British Energy Supplier Says It Will Cut 4,000 Jobs

docs.abstract: At a time when media companies old and new are laying off employees, a publication founded in 1857 goes against the grain with support from Laurene Powell Jobs.
docs.snippet: At a time when media companies old and new are laying off employees, a publication founded in 1857 goes against the grain with support from Laurene Powell Jobs.
docs.lead_paragraph: A media company is expanding its newsroom. You read that right.

headline.main: The Atlantic Plans a Hiring Spree
headline.print_headline: As Other Media Companies Cut Staff, The Atlantic Plans to Do the Opposite

docs.abstract: New electrical architecture will help satisfy the demands of cars that are increasingly loaded with gadgets and will enable lower-cost hybrid drive systems.
docs.snippet: New electrical architecture will help satisfy the demands of cars that are increasingly loaded with gadgets and will enable lower-cost hybrid drive systems.
docs.lead_paragraph: While automakers sketch out a world of sleek and silent electric cars or even self-driving pods that are more den than dragster, the all-electric future is further off than it may appear.

headline.main: To Power the Future, Carmakers Flip on 48-Volt Systems
